result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:50 am 
INCLUDES 15CM1864, 15CM435, 15CM718, AND 15CM2200. 
State appears by ADA Matt Adrian; Def appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM1864: Ct. 1 (Battery/Repeater/DA)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM435: Ct. 1 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM718: Ct. 1 (OAR/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2200: Ct. 2 (Resisting an Officer/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM1864: Ct. 2 (DC/DA/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM2200: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 12 months probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program or equivalent in home county; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no contact with T.R. unless authorized by agent; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC including 1 DA surcharge. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 14 days sentence credit if revoked in each case. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to def's county of residence.

for plea/sentencing on 11/10/2016
